Propose a core-linking round given an existing BT fit

Source: R/core_linking_pairs.R
bt_core_link_round.Rd

Convenience wrapper around select_core_link_pairs that uses fit$theta from a model fitted by fit_bt_model.

Usage

bt_core_link_round(samples, fit, core_ids, ...)

Arguments

samples

A tibble/data.frame with columns ID and text.

fit

A list returned by fit_bt_model that contains a $theta tibble with columns ID, theta, se.

core_ids

Character vector of core IDs.

...

Passed through to select_core_link_pairs (e.g., existing_pairs, round_size, seed, etc.).

Value

A list with:

pairs

Tibble of proposed pairs (ID1, ID2, pair_type).

plan

One-row tibble summarizing how many of each pair_type were returned.

Examples

samples <- tibble::tibble(ID = paste0("S", 1:8), text = paste("t", 1:8))
theta <- tibble::tibble(ID = samples$ID, theta = rnorm(8), se = runif(8, 0.2, 0.6))
fit <- list(theta = theta)
out <- bt_core_link_round(samples, fit, core_ids = paste0("S", 1:3), round_size = 6, seed = 1)
out$plan
#> # A tibble: 1 × 4
#>   n_total n_core_new n_new_new n_core_core
#>     <int>      <int>     <int>       <int>
#> 1       6          5         1           0
head(out$pairs)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 3
#>   ID1   ID2   pair_type
#>   <chr> <chr> <chr>    
#> 1 S6    S8    new_new  
#> 2 S1    S5    core_new 
#> 3 S4    S1    core_new 
#> 4 S7    S1    core_new 
#> 5 S3    S6    core_new 
#> 6 S5    S2    core_new
